verses.plain: I am come into my garden, my sister, my spouse: I have gathered my myrrh with my spice; I have eaten my honeycomb with my honey; I have drunk my wine with my milk: eat, O friends; drink, yea, drink abundantly, O beloved.

tokens.t: I am come into my garden, my sister,
spouse: I have gathered my myrrh with my spice; I have eaten my honeycomb with my honey; I have drunk my wine with my milk: eat, O friends; drink, yea, drink abundantly, O beloved.

verses.plain: ¶ I sleep, but my heart waketh: it is the voice of my beloved that knocketh, saying, Open to me, my sister, my love, my dove, my undefiled: for my head is filled with dew, and my locks with the drops of the night.

tokens.t: ¶ I sleep, but my heart waketh:
the voice of my beloved that knocketh,
, Open to me, my sister, my love, my dove, my undefiled: for my head is filled with dew,
my locks with the drops of the night.

verses.plain: I have put off my coat; how shall I put it on? I have washed my feet; how shall I defile them?

tokens.t: I have put off my coat; how shall I put it on? I have washed my feet; how shall I defile them?

verses.plain: My beloved put in his hand by the hole of the door, and my bowels were moved for him.

tokens.t: My beloved put in his hand by the hole
, and my bowels were moved for him.

verses.plain: I rose up to open to my beloved; and my hands dropped with myrrh, and my fingers with sweet smelling myrrh, upon the handles of the lock.

tokens.t: I rose up to open to my beloved; and my hands dropped
myrrh, and my fingers
sweet smelling myrrh, upon the handles of the lock.

verses.plain: I opened to my beloved; but my beloved had withdrawn himself, and was gone: my soul failed when he spake: I sought him, but I could not find him; I called him, but he gave me no answer.

tokens.t: I opened to my beloved; but my beloved had withdrawn himself,
was gone: my soul failed when he spake: I sought him, but I could not find him; I called him, but he gave me no answer.

verses.plain: The watchmen that went about the city found me, they smote me, they wounded me; the keepers of the walls took away my veil from me.

tokens.t: The watchmen that went about the city found me, they smote me, they wounded me; the keepers of the walls took away my veil from me.

verses.plain: I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, if ye find my beloved, that ye tell him, that I am sick of love.

tokens.t: I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, if ye find my beloved, that ye tell him, that I
sick of love.

verses.plain: ¶ What is thy beloved more than another beloved, O thou fairest among women? what is thy beloved more than another beloved, that thou dost so charge us?

tokens.t: ¶ What
thy beloved more than
beloved, O thou fairest among women? what
thy beloved more than
beloved, that thou dost so charge us?

verses.plain: My beloved is white and ruddy, the chiefest among ten thousand.

tokens.t: My beloved
white and ruddy, the chiefest among ten thousand.

verses.plain: His head is as the most fine gold, his locks are bushy, and black as a raven.

tokens.t: His head
the most fine gold, his locks
bushy,
black as a raven.

verses.plain: His eyes are as the eyes of doves by the rivers of waters, washed with milk, and fitly set.

tokens.t: His eyes
as
of doves by the rivers of waters, washed with milk,
fitly set.

verses.plain: His cheeks are as a bed of spices, as sweet flowers: his lips like lilies, dropping sweet smelling myrrh.

tokens.t: His cheeks
as a bed of spices,
sweet flowers: his lips
lilies, dropping sweet smelling myrrh.

verses.plain: His hands are as gold rings set with the beryl: his belly is as bright ivory overlaid with sapphires.

tokens.t: His hands
gold rings set with the beryl: his belly
bright ivory overlaid
sapphires.

verses.plain: His legs are as pillars of marble, set upon sockets of fine gold: his countenance is as Lebanon, excellent as the cedars.

tokens.t: His legs
pillars of marble, set upon sockets of fine gold: his countenance
as Lebanon, excellent as the cedars.

verses.plain: His mouth is most sweet: yea, he is altogether lovely. This is my beloved, and this is my friend, O daughters of Jerusalem.

tokens.t: His mouth
most sweet: yea, he
altogether lovely. This
my beloved, and this
my friend, O daughters of Jerusalem.

footnotes.text: yea…: or, and be drunken with loves
for him: or, (as some read) in me
sweet…: Heb. passing, or, running about
fitly…: Heb. sitting in fulness, that is, fitly placed, and set as a precious stone in the foil of a ring
sweet flowers: or, towers of perfumes
